src:
Zlatna desnica Polarda, neverovatni Mapipi i pakleni skram doneli ranjenim Gazelama treću krunu
Južnoafrički ragbisti u finalu Svetskog kupa u Jokohami slomili favorizovane Engleze sa 32:12 u meču sa dva eseja

02 Nov 2019

Južna Afrika je u Japanu osvojila Svetski kup u ragbiju pošto je sa 32:12 (12:6) slavila protiv favorizovane ekipe Engleske, a Sija Kolisi postao je prvi crnoputi kapiten koji je da podigao prestižni pehar. Takođe, ekipa JAR-a je prva ostvarila ovaj uspeh iako je doživela poraz na putu do titule (od N. Zelanda)
Englezi nisu uspeli da ponove meč iz polufinala kada su očigledno pregoreli srušivši tada još aktuelne šampiona planete, Novozelanđane. Znalački su to iskoristili Južnoafrikanci i osvojili treću svetsku krunu zadržavši tako trofej Veba Elisa na južnoj polulopti barem još četiri godine.
Kako smo i pretpostavili u najavi finala tako se i odigralo, pošto je većina poena na meču postignuta šutom. Ključ današnjeg uspeha Gazela je to što je selektor Rasi Erasmusm jednostavno pročitao igru izabranika Edija Džonsa, a Australijski stručnjak na klupi Engleza nije imao odgovor na agresivnu, ali pametnu igru protivnika.
Gazele su odmah krenulo jako i uporno gurajući favorizovane rivale u njihovu polovinu. Početna inicijativa, koju su uspešno u pobedu upravo Englezi ostvarili protiv Novog Zelanda u polufinalu iznenadivši tako verovatno najboklji tim sveta, sada je recept koji su primenili Afrikaneri. I to uspešno, pošto su nakon devet minuta stigli do prednosti iz penala koji je izveo Andre Polard. Selektor Springboksa Erasmus mogao je samo da sanja ovakav start
Na izjednačenje se čekalo do 22. minuta kada je Oven Farel iskoristio takođe penal, te je meč krenuo od nule, a delovalo je da su se Englezi konačno oslobodili čeličnog stiska Južnoafrikanaca. Međutim, nakon odličnog napada Gazele, koje su imale nekoliko povreda značajnih igrača tokom prvog dela meča, ponovo su vratile prednost od tri poena nakon samo tri minuta i to naravno šutem fantastičnog Polarda.
Ruže su tokom većeg dela prvog poluvremena delovale pogubljeno, posebno kada bi njihovi protivnici silovito kretali u napad. Reprezentacija koja je totalno zaustavila prošlog vikenda Ol blekse, sada su doživljavali to isto. Međutim, opterećeni povredama, koje su uzrokovale dosta grešaka Južnoafrikanci su popuštali, te je došlo do izjednačenja pet minuta pre kraja prvog dela finala u Jokohami.
Ali, ranjene Gazele se nisu predavale i ponovo su uspele da se proguraju do nova dva penala, a Polard je naravno bio neumoljiv oba puta. S obzirom na ono što se videlo u prvih 40 minuta igre za titulu, pre svega zbog dominacije Afrikanera u skramu, sasvim zasluženo su otišli na odmor sa šest poena prednosti.
Kako je završeno prvo, tako je počelo drugo poluvreme, naravno golom neverovatnog Polarda iz penala nakon pet minuta igre. Englezi su u tim momentima delovali kao tim koji jednostavno ne može da pobedi. Uspele su Ruže ipak, zahvaljujući manjim promenama u timu i taktici da ubrzo smanje zaostatak na šest poena 9:15, naravno preciznim šutem Farela. To kao da im je dalo krila, a sa druge strane Gazele kao da je stigao umor, te su njihove greške načinjene uglavnom pod pritiskom osokoljenih Engleza počele polako da vraćaju egal na terenu. Nakon 15 minuta igre u drugom poluvremenu usledio je prvi promašaj Farela sa penala i to u trenutku kada je njegov tim bio u naletu.
Odmah je, očekivano usledila kazna, a ubitačni Andre Polard je ponovo bio neumoljiv za 18:9. Igra se rasplamsala, jer Englezi jednostavno nisu više smeli da dozvole dalji razvoj situacije koja im nije išla u korist, te su brzo uzvratili, ponovo prteko šuta Ovena Farela za 18:12. Čekao se taj jedan esej koji bi ili obrnuo stanje na terenu u Jokohamil ili bi definitivno rešio pitanje pobednika. Usledio je prvi promašaj Polarda u meču, kada lopta nije ni stigla do gola. Da je u tom 63. minutu bio na visini zadatka, možda bi i završio posao za reprezentaciju sa Crnog kontinenta.



Taj esej koji je čekao doašo je naklon konfuzne situacije na terenu iz koje su Afrikaneri izašli kao jači, to jest Makazole Mapimpi koji se ušeo u zonu protiuvnika. Slavlje je već tada moglo da polčne po Južnoj Africi. Levo krilo Gazela je deifitnivno uz Polarda bio najbolji u ovom finalu. Polard je uradio svoj deo posla, dodao još dva poena iz šuta za neuhvatljivo vođstvo od 25:12. Sve je bilo gotovo u 73. minutu kada je za Južnu Afriku, nakon iznužđene greške Ruža drugi esej postigao prebrzi Česlin Kolbe. Slavlje je već tada moglo da počne, jer 20 poena prednosti je bilo nemoguće stići.
Naredni Svetski kup vraća ragbi na kontinent odakle je krenuo u osvajanja sveta, pošto je Francuska domaćin 2023.




(Foto: Reuters)
text:
Polard's Golden Right, the Amazing Mapipi and the Hell Scramble for the Wounded Gazelles Third Crown
South African rugby players beat favored English in 32:12 in Yokohama World Cup final with two essays

02 Nov 2019

South Africa won the Rugby World Cup in Japan as it celebrated against England's favored squad with 32:12 (12: 6) and Sia Kolisi became the first black captain to lift the prestigious cup. Also, the JAR team was the first to achieve this success, although it was defeated on the way to the title (by N. Zealand)
The English failed to repeat the match from the semi-finals when they were apparently blown out by knocking down the then current champions of the planet, the New Zealanders. This was exploited by the South Africans and won the third world crown, thus retaining the Web Elis trophy in the Southern Hemisphere for at least four more years.
As we expected in the announcement of the finals, this is how it played out, as most points in the match were scored by a shot. The key to Gazelle's success today is that coach Rasi Erasmusm simply read the game of pick Eddie Jones, and the Australian expert on the English bench did not have the answer to an aggressive but clever play by the opponent.
The gazelles immediately went strong and persistently, pushing the favored rivals into their half. The initial initiative, which was successfully won by the English against New Zealand in the semifinals, thus surprisingly arguably the wildest team in the world, is now a recipe applied by the Afrikaners. And successfully, after nine minutes, they came to an advantage from a penalty shot by Andre Polard. Springboks coach Erasmus could only dream of a start like this
The equalizer waited until the 22nd minute when Owen Farrell also used a penalty, and the match started from scratch, and it seemed that the English had finally released the steel grip of the South Africans. However, after an excellent attack by Gazelles, who had several injuries to significant players during the first part of the match, they regained the advantage by three points after only three minutes, and of course I shot a fantastic Polard.
For most of the first half, the Roses seemed executed, especially when their opponents moved violently into attack. The team that totally stopped the Ol Blakes last weekend were now experiencing the same thing. However, burdened by injuries, which caused a lot of mistakes, the South Africans relented, and equalized five minutes before the end of the first leg of the final in Yokohama.
But the wounded Gazellas did not surrender and were again able to push themselves to the next two penalties, and Polard was of course relentless both times. Given what was seen in the first 40 minutes of the title game, primarily due to the Afrikaner’s dominance in the scramble, they quite deservedly went on vacation with a six point advantage.
As the first ended, so began the second half, of course the goal of the incredible Polard from penalty after five minutes of play. In those moments, the English acted as a team that simply could not win. The Roses did, however, thanks to minor changes to the team and tactics to shorten the gap to six points 9:15, of course with Farrell's precise shot. This seemed to give them wings, and on the other side of the Gazelle, as if fatigue had arrived, their mistakes, made mainly by the pressure of the enraged Englishmen, began to slowly return egal on the ground. After 15 minutes of play in the second half, Farel's first penalty was missed when his team was in a rush.
Immediately, the penalty was expected, and the deadly Andre Polard was again relentless by 18: 9. The game flared up because the English simply were no longer allowed to further develop a situation that did not benefit them, and they quickly retaliated, again fiercely silencing Owen Farrell for 18:12. There was waiting for that one essay that would either turn the state of the field into Yokohamail or would definitely solve the winner’s question. Polard's first miss came in the match when the ball didn't even reach the goal. If he was up to the task in the 63rd minute, he might have finished the national team job from the Black Continent.



That waiting essay came in favor of a confusing situation on the ground from which the Afrikaners emerged as stronger, that is, Makazole Mapimpi who entered the counter-zone. The celebration could have taken off in South Africa by then. Gazel's left wing was the best in this finale, in addition to Polard. Polard did his share of the work, adding two more points from the shot for an elusive 25:12 lead. It was all over in the 73rd minute when South Africa, after an exhausted mistake by Rose, scored the second essay by speeding Cheslin Kolbe. The celebration could have already started, because 20 points of advantage were impossible to get.
The next World Cup returns rugby to the continent from where it set out to conquer the world, as France hosts 2023.




(Photo by Reuters)
